title: Thousands Flee Southern Lebanon, as Israel Presses Air Attack on Hezbollah
content: Lebanese health officials said Israeli attacks since Monday have killed hundreds, including women and children. Israel claimed it had killed one senior Hezbollah commander with an airstrike Tuesday on a building in the southern suburbs of Beirut.
summary: Lebanese health officials said Israeli attacks since Monday have killed hundreds, including women and children. Israel claimed it had killed one senior Hezbollah commander with an airstrike Tuesday on a building in the southern suburbs of Beirut.

title: U.N. General Assembly: U.N. Live Updates: World Leaders Confront Global Turmoil at U.N.
content: Hours after President Biden delivered his final U.N. speech, Masoud Pezeshkian, who was elected in July, gave his first.
summary: Hours after President Biden delivered his final U.N. speech, Masoud Pezeshkian, who was elected in July, gave his first.

title: In Beirut, Israel’s Strikes Stoke Fears of War
content: With Monday’s attacks across southern Lebanon, the prospect of the escalating conflict enveloping the city has suddenly become real for many Beirut residents.
summary: With Monday’s attacks across southern Lebanon, the prospect of the escalating conflict enveloping the city has suddenly become real for many Beirut residents.

title: Ukrainian Poet and Rock Star Fights Near Front and Performs Behind It
content: Serhiy Zhadan, 50, is a beloved Ukrainian poet as well as a novelist, lyricist and rock star. Furious over the invasion, he enlisted to fight even as his band still plays and his readings fill halls.
summary: Serhiy Zhadan, 50, is a beloved Ukrainian poet as well as a novelist, lyricist and rock star. Furious over the invasion, he enlisted to fight even as his band still plays and his readings fill halls.

title: How a Leftist Jolted Sri Lanka’s Politics and Presidency
content: Anura Kumara Dissanayake offered his broad leftist coalition as the best hope for a different political culture, one not ruled by nepotism and corruption.
summary: Anura Kumara Dissanayake offered his broad leftist coalition as the best hope for a different political culture, one not ruled by nepotism and corruption.

title: As Lebanon Reels From Israeli Attacks, the Future Is Murky for a Wounded Hezbollah
content: Some experts said that Israel’s onslaught had left Hezbollah in disarray. Others noted its large weapons stockpiles and history of adapting to battle Israel’s much more high-tech military.
summary: Some experts said that Israel’s onslaught had left Hezbollah in disarray. Others noted its large weapons stockpiles and history of adapting to battle Israel’s much more high-tech military.

title: In Rare Graft Case in Singapore, Former Minister Pleads Guilty
content: S. Iswaran, the former transport minister, had maintained his innocence on the corruption charge for months but on Tuesday pleaded guilty to five lesser offenses.
summary: S. Iswaran, the former transport minister, had maintained his innocence on the corruption charge for months but on Tuesday pleaded guilty to five lesser offenses.

title: U.K.’s Starmer Sprinkles Kamala Harris-style ‘Joy’ Into Conference Speech

summary: After a somewhat bumpy start to his premiership, Keir Starmer tried to reclaim the narrative, acknowledging voters’ desire for hope and promising change was on the way.

title: Forced From Home by War, They Found Solace in Soccer
content: For dozens of women who fled Myanmar and settled in Thailand, soccer has become a refuge from both the troubles of daily life and conservative cultural norms.
summary: For dozens of women who fled Myanmar and settled in Thailand, soccer has become a refuge from both the troubles of daily life and conservative cultural norms.

title: As U.N. Meets, Pressure Mounts on Biden to Loosen Up on Arms for Ukraine

summary: Finland’s president and NATO’s departing secretary general are urging Mr. Biden to allow Ukraine to use weapons to hit bases deeper inside Russia.

title: U.N. Meets Amid a Backdrop of Growing Chaos and Violence
content: Beginning Tuesday, world leaders will discuss three wars, climate change, rising sea levels and proposals to expand representation on the Security Council.

title: Tanzania Arrests Opposition Leaders Ahead of Planned Protest
content: The East African country’s leading opposition party said that its presidential candidate in the last election and its chairman were among dozens detained before a protest called to draw attention to the killing and abduction of government critics.
summary: The East African country’s leading opposition party said that its presidential candidate in the last election and its chairman were among dozens detained before a protest called to draw attention to the killing and abduction of government critics.

title: Russian Military Plane Breaches Japan’s Airspace
content: The infringements were the first by Russia in five years, according to the Japanese defense ministry. A fighter fired a warning flare in response.
summary: The infringements were the first by Russia in five years, according to the Japanese defense ministry. A fighter fired a warning flare in response.

title: Supermarkets in Australia Sued Over Claims of Fake Discounts

title: Gisèle Pelicot Has Become a Feminist Hero in France Amid Rape Trial
content: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. Her poise and courage have made her an icon.
summary: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. Her poise and courage have made her an icon.

title: Iran’s Dilemma: How to Preserve Its Proxies and Avoid Full-Scale War

title: Israeli Bulldozers Flatten Mile After Mile in the West Bank

title: France Rape Trial Renews Push to Revise Legal Definition of Rape
content: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. The trial has revived the question of consent within French law and turned Ms. Pelicot into a feminist icon. Catherine Porter, an international correspondent for The New York Times based in France, explains.
summary: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. The trial has revived the question of consent within French law and turned Ms. Pelicot into a feminist icon. Catherine Porter, an international correspondent for The New York Times based in France, explains.

title: In the Footsteps of Dostoyevsky in Three German Spa Towns
content: The Russian novelist, a compulsive gambler, lost everything in the opulent spa and gambling towns of Baden-Baden, Bad Homburg and Wiesbaden. An admirer of his books follows his footsteps.
